Village:HardwareHackingArea.title: Surface Mount Electronics Assembly for Terrified Beginners - electronic kitten EXPERIMENTAL WORKSHOP
Village:HardwareHackingArea.subtitle: EXPERIMENTAL Day 1 - 20:00

Learn to assemble tiny parts on circuit boards by building an electronic touch-activated purring kitten. Anyone can do it. Yes, even you who never touched anything electronic before. 90-100mins, 20€/kit, avoid caffeine immediately before. Max 5 participants per session, there is a PAPER!!1! signup list in the hardware hacking area.

Village:Three Headed Monkey.title: Über die Nachhaltigkeit von Software
Village:Three Headed Monkey.subtitle: location: Planke (Bühne)
Village:Three Headed Monkey.description: Software ist essenzieller Bestandteil und Ressource unserer Dienstleistungs- und Wissensgesellschaft sowie unserer Infrastrukturen. Als Ressource betrachtet verhält sich der Konsum und Erhalt von Software jedoch in vielen Dingen konträr zu natürlichen Ressourcen. Eine Reflektion über die besonderen Eigenschaften der "Ressource Software" und wie wir diese nutzen können um Software nachhaltig zu gestalten und damit auch für die Zukunft zu erhalten.

Village:Three Headed Monkey.title: Denn so wissen wir, was sie tun: Das Berliner Transparenzgesetz
Village:Three Headed Monkey.subtitle: location: Planke (Bühne)
Village:Three Headed Monkey.description: Ein Hoch auf Volksentscheide! Wir erzählen vom Berliner Volksentscheid für ein Transparenzgesetz, das wir ins Leben gerufen haben. Hier könnt ihr unterschreiben. Und wir zeigen, wie ihr mitmachen könnt.

Village:Three Headed Monkey.title: Dissecting the AMD Platform Security Processor
Village:Three Headed Monkey.subtitle: location: Planke (Bühne)
Village:Three Headed Monkey.description: The AMD Platform Security Processor (PSP) is a security subsystem in AMD CPUs comparable to the Intel ME and was introduced in 2013. It is essential for system startup – in fact, in runs before the main processor is even started – and offers runtime services to the main processor. For this, it has full access to the system memory space (inlcuding MMIO).  The PSP runs undocumented, proprietary firmware. This talk presents efforts of investigating what the PSP does and if it's secure. For the first time, it documents the PSP firmware's proprietary filesystem and provides insights into reverse-engineering such a deeply embedded system as the PSP. The talk further sheds light on how we might regain trust in AMD CPUs despite the delicate nature of the PSP.

Village:Three Headed Monkey.title: Werdeteildesgesamtwiderstandes

Village:Three Headed Monkey.description: werdeteildesgesamtwiderstandes ist eine Objekt gewordene Handlungsanweisung die dazu anregt sich mit anderen menschen zu verbinden. Village:HardwareHackingArea.subtitle: Day 2
Village:HardwareHackingArea.description:
''Learn Arduino using TV-B-Gone as an example project''

You've probably heard lots about '''Arduino'''. But if you don't know what it is, or how you can use it to do all sorts of cool things, then this fun and easy workshop is for you. As an example project, we'll be creating a '''TV-B-Gone''' remote control out of an '''Arduino''' you can take home with you.

''(This is one of many cool things happening throughout CCCamp 2019 in the huge '''Hardware Hacking Area!)'''''

This workshop will be given twice
(both identical):

   Day 3: 23-Aug, 1pm - 4:30pm

Seating area south of Milliways (S9 on m.title: OctoPrint User Meetup
Seating area south of Milliways (S9 on m.description: Meet and greet of OctoPrint users at the camp. foosel will also be there and bring stickers!

Village:Kidspace.description: Wir basteln gemeinsam einen laufenden Roboter

Village:Kidspace.title: Tetrapixels
Village:Kidspace.description: We build blinking objects with Tetrapacks and Arduinos

Village:C-base.title: Pentagame
Village:C-base.description: New abstract board game explained and played

Village:ZSH - Zelt Stadt Hessen.title: Poly*-/RA-Meetup
Village:ZSH - Zelt Stadt Hessen.description: Let's hang around, talk about concepts of interpersonal relationships

Village:Metalab Dome.title: Regio Mediation
Village:Metalab Dome.description: Streitigkeiten, die sich schon tiefer in einen Verein eingetreten haben oder sogar mit Machtgefällen behaftet sind, sind nicht einfach aus der Welt zu schaffen und können eine gute Vereinsarbeit über lange Zeit lähmen.  Wir glauben, um diese Probleme zu lösen, könnenn uns die Techniken der Mediation weiterhelfen.  Wir vermuten außerdem, dass schon viel Erfahrung im CCC und seinen Mitgliedern schlummert und wollen euch einladen mit uns Idee noch weiter auszuarbeiten.

Village:Harbor.title: SocialTech
Village:Harbor.subtitle: SocialTech #1
Village:Harbor.description: Workshop: Accessibility and Inclusion - Hacking everyday communication practices to change the world.

Village:RoboVillage.title: SumoRobot programming
Village:RoboVillage.subtitle: Day 2 afternoon
Village:RoboVillage.description: DECT 7866 - You will be able to write your awesome algorithm and get a blast on the SumoRobot match.

Village:RoboVillage.subtitle: Day 2 evening
Village:RoboVillage.description: DECT 7866 - You will be able to write your awesome algorithm and get a blast on the SumoRobot match.

Village:RoboVillage.subtitle: Day 2 afternoon

Village:RoboVillage.description: DECT 7866 - Come solder your own SumoRobot and have a blast later at the SumoRobot match.

Hackcenter.title: Bodymind Operating System
Hackcenter.description: Physical practice session where we explore the notions of hacking through the human body.

Hackcenter.title: SUSI.AI Open Source Voice Assistant
Hackcenter.subtitle: Learn about SUSI.AI and how to build your own smart speaker
Hackcenter.description: We are developing a smart speaker that can play music through voice commands. Users can play music from online resources such as radio stations, YouTube, their cloud folder (e.g. Nextcloud) as well as from locally connected USB sticks or music available in the local network.

Goldberg (Workshop 2).title: Extra Thumb Workshop
Goldberg (Workshop 2).description: Make yourself an extra functional thumb, and see if you like it.

Goldberg (Workshop 2).title: Learning to see in 3D
Goldberg (Workshop 2).subtitle: Introduction, Hands-On
Goldberg (Workshop 2).description: Can you hack how you see with Virtual RealiTy to rediscover your full sense of 3D?  Try out the new system, meet other interested people, plot and plan.

Village:Backspace.title: Beer Tasting
Village:Backspace.subtitle: 1st round of Beer Tasting
Village:Backspace.description: Taste a variety of beers from Franconia

Village:Chaoswelle.title: Customizing Bluetooth and Wi-Fi Firmware
Village:Chaoswelle.subtitle: Binary patching for Broadcom Wi-Fi/Bluetooth combo chips
Village:Chaoswelle.description: Introduction talk to binary patching with Nexmon for Wi-Fi and Bluetooth. Followed by a practical part with a focus on patching Bluetooth on off-the-shelf smartphones and laptops with a Broadcom Bluetooth chip.

Village:ChaosZone.title: An introduction to the post-apocalyptic skill of spinning yarn
Village:ChaosZone.description: We will show you and explain how to make your own yarn from wool and other fibres.

Village:HardwareHackingArea.title: Arduino For Total Newbies
Village:HardwareHackingArea.subtitle: Day 3
Village:HardwareHackingArea.description:
''Learn Arduino using TV-B-Gone as an example project''

You've probably heard lots about '''Arduino'''. But if you don't know what it is, or how you can use it to do all sorts of cool things, then this fun and easy workshop is for you. As an example project, we'll be creating a '''TV-B-Gone''' remote control out of an '''Arduino''' you can take home with you.

''(This is one of many cool things happening throughout CCCamp 2019 in the huge '''Hardware Hacking Area!)'''''

This workshop will be given twice
(both identical):
   Day 2: 22-Aug, 1pm - 4:30pm
   Day 3: 23-Aug, 1pm - 4:30pm

Village:HardwareHackingArea.title: Bristlebots for kids!
Village:HardwareHackingArea.subtitle: Day 3
Village:HardwareHackingArea.description: DE/EN/FI Build a little electronic insect robot from a toothbrush and a motor

Village:HardwareHackingArea.title: Geiger Counter Workshop
Village:HardwareHackingArea.subtitle: Geiger Counter Workshop 2
Village:HardwareHackingArea.description: Build a working Geiger Counter

Village:HardwareHackingArea.title: Learn To Solder
Village:HardwareHackingArea.subtitle: Day 3
Village:HardwareHackingArea.description:
Learn to Solder! A large variety of way cool kits are available, all designed for total beginners to complete successfully -- and intriguing enough for the total hardware geek.

'''''This ongoing workshop will be happening concurrently with lots of other way cool workshops at the Hardware Hacking Area! All day & all night, throughout all of CCCamp2019.'''''

Village:HardwareHackingArea.title: Mechanical Keyboard Meetup
Village:HardwareHackingArea.subtitle: Hands-on
Village:HardwareHackingArea.description: Try out a mechanical keyboard or show off your collection.

Village:HardwareHackingArea.title: Surface Mount Electronics Assembly for Terrified Beginners
Village:HardwareHackingArea.subtitle: Day 3 - 17:30
Village:HardwareHackingArea.description: Surface mount electronics for terrified beginners. Learn to assemble tiny parts on circuit boards by building a working power supply. Anyone can do it. Yes, even you who never touched anything electronic before. 90-100mins, 20€/kit, avoid caffeine immediately before. Max 17 participants per session, there is a PAPER!!1! signup list in the hardware hacking area.

Village:HardwareHackingArea.title: Surface Mount Electronics Assembly for Terrified Beginners
Village:HardwareHackingArea.subtitle: Day 3 - 20:00
Village:HardwareHackingArea.description: Surface mount electronics for terrified beginners. Learn to assemble tiny parts on circuit boards by building a working power supply. Anyone can do it. Yes, even you who never touched anything electronic before. 90-100mins, 20€/kit, avoid caffeine immediately before. Max 17 participants per session, there is a PAPER!!1! signup list in the hardware hacking area.

Village:1komona.title: ArtesMobiles - SpeculativeAI
Village:1komona.subtitle: 4pm - 6pm every 15 min
Village:1komona.description: Performance // audiovisual experiment // @12m long white Bus with rooftop terasse

Village:1komona.title: Networking Basics on the Command Line
Village:1komona.description: @Heart of code-dome, by Theresa! What's an IP address and how do you get it? How does your computer manage to reach the whole world? How can you check what part of it went wrong? This hands-on workshop will give a basic overview of some networking concepts and tools, such as ip, ping, and traceroute. Then you will have time to try out the tools for yourself. Please bring a laptop.

Village:1komona.title: Postapokalyptic jewellery
Village:1komona.subtitle: scrap tinkering - schrottbasteln
Village:1komona.description: living in the postapocalypse and noticing the beauty of relicts of human civilisation, we start to adorn and grace ourselves with it. the workshop offers to create more or less pretty jewellery things out of a big collection of found objects. bring your own nuggets or choose from provided material. there will be a donation box as sad enough the apocalypse didn't make capitalism history.

Village:Scottish Consulate.title: BSD Users and Developers Meetup
Village:Scottish Consulate.description: Meetup for BSD Users and Developers

Village:Scottish Consulate.title: Scottish Drinking Night
Village:Scottish Consulate.description: Come and join The Scottish Consulate for our semi regular outreach event, learn to drink like a true scotsperson.

Village:Milliways.title: Blockchain Interoperability
Village:Milliways.description: Unidirectional and bidirectional crosschain transfers using NIPoPoWs and Proof-of-Burn

Village:Milliways.title: Modding Milliways - Low-poly Whiskyleaks
Village:Milliways.subtitle: Low-poly buildup pt.4
Village:Milliways.description: A livestream at Milliways of CCC being modded into a videogame

Village:NixOS.title: Bootstrapping NixOS
Village:NixOS.description: learn how Nixers bootstrap their hosts

Village:NixOS.title: Terranix
Village:NixOS.description: A NixOS way to create terraform json files.

Village:About:freedom.title: C3Sus Ride excellent with each other
Village:About:freedom.subtitle: about:sessions
Village:About:freedom.description: make something better than https://events.ccc.de/camp/2019/wiki/Hitchhiking

Village:About:freedom.title: FifF-Stammtische everywhere
Village:About:freedom.subtitle: about:stage

Village:About:freedom.title: Freedom Cruise, about:GFF
Village:About:freedom.subtitle: about:stage

Village:About:freedom.title: Freedom to go - an interactive workshop from An- to F- to G-Droid
Village:About:freedom.subtitle: about:sessions
Village:About:freedom.description: An interactive workshop to present the Free Software App repository called F-Droid and the outstanding functionalities of its clients called F-Droid and G-Droid.  After that we discover the best (imho!) Android-based Free Software apps including methods of anonymization and encryption - and you will have the possibility to present your personal favorite Free Software app as well.

Village:About:freedom.title: Global Climate Strike: exchange of ideas and experiences about organizing strikes and demonstrations
Village:About:freedom.subtitle: about:stage
Village:About:freedom.description: The climate crisis is an emergency but we’re not acting like it. Especially in political organizations like the Chaos Community this topic has to be more present, more visible. Our hotter planet is already hurting millions of people. We are not only in one of the best positions to provide technology for change, but we also should show that we belong to the people behind the movements like Fridays For Future or Global Climate Strike.

Village:About:freedom.title: How to shape a responsible world?
Village:About:freedom.subtitle: Follow up
Village:About:freedom.description: As activists we seek for a fundamental change in this world towards a fair and responsible society. The invited groups will give their analysis of the problems and present their work. Together we will identify questions or common projects we will work on in the follow-up workshops.

Village:About:freedom.title: R5 Meeting (CCC working group)
Village:About:freedom.subtitle: about:stage
Village:About:freedom.description: Reuse, Repair, Recycle, Rethink, Redesign (R5) is a working group of the CCC. This session is for people that are already part of it, and people that would like to get involved.

Village:About:freedom.title: Substrate verifiable credentials - build your first infrastructure blockchain
Village:About:freedom.description: In this workshop you'll learn to build your own infrastructure blockchain (for verifiable credentials) using Substrate, Rust and WebAssembly.

Village:About:freedom.title: Wifi4EU - broken by technical specifications
Village:About:freedom.subtitle: about:stage
Village:About:freedom.description: With the Wifi4EU programm the EU is planning to spend 100 million € by 2020 to subsidise a centralized surveillance infrastructure for centers of public life in the EU. The talk will lay out how Wifi4EU is supposed to work both administratively and technically, where there are problems with the later and what is and can be done about it.

Village:CCC-CH.title: CCC-CH Gettogether
Village:CCC-CH.description: Das Gettogether des CCC-CH am CCCamp19

Village:Foodhackingbase.title: Cheese Rendezvous
Village:Foodhackingbase.subtitle: Session II.
Village:Foodhackingbase.description: Selection of delicious cheeses and condiments for you!

Village:Reclaim Club Culture.title: Club culture against the monopoly of Facebook
Village:Reclaim Club Culture.description: Reclaim Club Culture goes Feediverse, we want to learn about alternatives to facebook: We need a platform that includes social multimedia feeds and most importantly: a calendar for mobilization/invitation. We will prepare a campaign to get institutions of the cultural scene to use that alternative platform.

Village:LaTeX.title: Einführung in LaTeX
Village:LaTeX.subtitle: (Individual 1h events, not a series - you can come to any of those)
Village:LaTeX.description: Short introduction into typesetting with LaTeX for complete beginners

Village:LaTeX.title: Xspace – Solution to an annoying TeX quirk
Village:LaTeX.description: Let's have a look how xspace.sty makes TeX's treatment of whitespace more predictable!

Hackcenter 3.title: Contributing to nixpkgs for Newbies
Hackcenter 3.description: Learn how you can contribute to the nixpkgs git repo

Village:Three Headed Monkey.title: Cryptography of Killing Proof-of-Work
Village:Three Headed Monkey.subtitle: Location: Planke (Bühne)
Village:Three Headed Monkey.description: We briefly discuss the range of cryptographic primitives being used by protocols that seek to make proof-of-work protocols obsolete. We shall focus primarily on these cryptographic building blocks themselves, not overly on the different protocols built form them.

Village:Three Headed Monkey.title: Emulate, fuzz, break kernels
Village:Three Headed Monkey.subtitle: location: Planke (Bühne)
Village:Three Headed Monkey.description: This talk will give an introduction to kernel fuzzing using unicorefuzz.

Village:Three Headed Monkey.title: Sinn von Unsinn unterscheiden - Glaub ich's oder glaub ich's nicht?
Village:Three Headed Monkey.subtitle: location: Planke (Bühne)
Village:Three Headed Monkey.description: Pyramiden wurden von Außerirdischen gebaut! Impfen macht Autismus! Gott hat die Welt geschaffen!

Village:Haecksen.title: Der Haecksen-Hack
Village:Haecksen.description: Die Haecksen erklären das Memorial-Projekt und die Briefmarken und freuen sich auf konstruktive Kritik und Ideen

Village:Haecksen.title: Junges Chaos Bildet Banden
Village:Haecksen.description: Wir wollen Junge Leute im Chaos Umfeld vernetzen und die Jugendarbeit in den einzelnen Spaces stärken. Komm vorbei, trink eine Mate und lass die Welt verändern.

Village:Haecksen.title: Märchenstunde (für Erwachsene)
Village:Haecksen.subtitle: Teil 3: Meine Großmutter war ein Computer! - von den ENIAC Girls bis zum Harem von Pickering

Village:Kidspace.title: FabScanPi - 3D Laser Scanner Workshop
Village:Kidspace.subtitle: Build your own 3D-Scanner
Village:Kidspace.description: Build your own Open Source 3D Laser Scanner.

Village:Free Software Foundation Europe.title: Free Software Song sing-along
Village:Free Software Foundation Europe.description: Everyday at 19:30 in the Cluster about:freedom we invite you to sing together the Free Software song; We have the lyrics and a conductor. Simply come, bring your hacker buddies and your voice and maybe an instrument and we form an ad-hoc choir and sing out loud our love for Free Software!

Village:Harbor.subtitle: A short repetition of the talk from day 1 before the maritime hackers meetup

Village:Harbor.description: Maritime hackers meet for socializing and discussion

Village:Munich Maker Village.subtitle: Particulate Matter Sensor Workshop II
Village:Munich Maker Village.description: Build your own particle matter sensor by using COTS electronics components even without soldering (design by OK Lab Stuttgart)

Village:Fri3d Camp.description: Open meeting to discuss design & ethics of IoT

Village:C-base.description: New abstract board game explained and played

Village:Ecohackerfarm.description: a perfect opportunity to find out what powerplant is all about

Village:Chaos-West.title: WoW! Dancing like a Blood Elf...
Village:Chaos-West.description: Learn how to dance for real like the male blood elf in world of warcraft in 5 steps. Beginner's class. All gender welcome!

Johnson (Workshop 1).title: Fair Ticket Sales on a Capitalist World
Johnson (Workshop 1).subtitle: Welcome to capitalism where prices regulate the differences between deman and supply, or do they?
Johnson (Workshop 1).description: In this open discussion we will discuss solutions taken by organizations to address ticket sales at fair prices when demand significantly outgrows supply

Johnson (Workshop 1).title: You broke the internet, let us build a GNU one

Village:About:freedom.title: Advanced web tracking methods
Village:About:freedom.subtitle: about:stage
Village:About:freedom.description: Advanced browser tracking techniques have developed over the last decade that allow remote sites to leverage the increasingly feature-rich web to track users without their knowledge or consent.  Not only are distinct visits across sites logged via techniques such as browser fingerprinting, sites that handle our most intimate details are monitoring our behavior on pages and handing that information to third parties with little to no regard to our privacy.  This will cover some of those advanced techniques that have emerged, and how to protect yourself against pervasive web tracking.

Village:About:freedom.title: Bandwidth Matters, Information controls in a conflict state in India
Village:About:freedom.description: What does information controls look like in conflict states of India? How does indias surveillance apparatus further intensify the information controls in conflict areas? How does this affect the everyday life of people esp women living and promoting peace in these regions?

Village:About:freedom.title: Decentrathon
Village:About:freedom.subtitle: Hacksession
Village:About:freedom.description: the decentralisation hackathon

Village:About:freedom.title: Decentrathon
Village:About:freedom.subtitle: Pitches
Village:About:freedom.description: the decentralisation hackathon

Village:About:freedom.title: Discussion on privacy-friendly green policies in the European Union
Village:About:freedom.subtitle: about:sessions
Village:About:freedom.description: How can we combine environmental issues with privacy-friendly solutions? Knowing that privacy comes at a cost of efficiency, what should the red lines be in the privacy VS environment debate? Is the fight for privacy in green policy the beginning of the end for surveillance capitalism?

Village:About:freedom.title: Freedom Cruise, about:PNR
Village:About:freedom.subtitle: about:stage

Village:About:freedom.title: Illegal content online – Bringing rights-based solutions to the EU table
Village:About:freedom.subtitle: about:stage
Village:About:freedom.description: EDRi proposes a political workshop to stress-test human rights-based solutions to ongoing debates in EU Brussels bubble: platforms' responsibilities towards illegal content online, prosecution of online crimes and conditions for law enforcement to access online evidence.

Village:About:freedom.title: Ink!: Write Wasm smart contracts with Rust
Village:About:freedom.description: A comprehensive, end-to-end tutorial for building an ERC20 token using Parity Substrate and ink! - build on Rust and wasm

Village:About:freedom.title: Substrate Collectibles - Build your own blockchain-backed asset exchange
Village:About:freedom.subtitle: Second Iteration
Village:About:freedom.description: This workshop will take you through building your own collectibles blockchain  - think "CryptoKitties" - using Substrate, Rust and WebAssembly.

Village:Chaoswelle.description: Ein Blick in die Trickkiste der modernen Digimodes JT65/JT9 und FT8/FT4.

Village:HardwareHackingArea.subtitle: EXPERIMENTAL Day 4 - 17:30
Village:HardwareHackingArea.description: Experimental new workshop - Surface mount electronics for terrified beginners. Learn to assemble tiny parts on circuit boards by building an electronic touch-activated purring kitten. Anyone can do it. Yes, even you who never touched anything electronic before. 90-100mins, 20€/kit, avoid caffeine immediately before. Max 5 participants per session, there is a PAPER!!1! signup list in the hardware hacking area.

Open to all, prior knowledge on decentralization required (you should be familiar with at least one decentralization protocol/app/platform, such as dat, XMPP, Mastodon, Tor, ...). We'll bring sharpies!

Village:HardwareHackingArea.title: Learn To Solder
Village:HardwareHackingArea.subtitle: Day 5
Village:HardwareHackingArea.description:
Learn to Solder! A large variety of way cool kits are available, all designed for total beginners to complete successfully -- and intriguing enough for the total hardware geek.

'''''This ongoing workshop will be happening concurrently with lots of other way cool workshops at the Hardware Hacking Area! All day & all night, throughout all of CCCamp2019.'''''

Village:1komona.title: Postapokalyptic jewellery
Village:1komona.subtitle: scrap tinkering - schrottbasteln
Village:1komona.description: living in the postapocalypse and noticing the beauty of relicts of human civilisation, we start to adorn and grace ourselves with it. the workshop offers to create more or less pretty jewellery things out of a big collection of found objects. bring your own nuggets or choose from provided material. there will be a donation box as sad enough the apocalypse didn't make capitalism history.
